member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore
member.summary: The actual code of the license class is put into an internal class and made into long functions to make it harder for the crackers to find anything meaningful after the dlls were cracked in November 2005.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.AsposeDot
member.summary: Used in the product mapping to build full product name. This is to avoid other developers accidentally damaging this code when doing global rename.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.SetLicenseCore(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.GetLicenseState
member.summary: Call this from your component code to check if running evaluation version or not.

example.code: if (Aspose.Words.LicenseCore.GetLicenseState() == LicenseState.Evaluation) InjectWatermark();

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.CheckEdition(Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.EditionType,System.String)
member.summary:
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.
Call this when the user attempts to use a feature that is limited by edition type. Throws a message explaining the license limitation to the user.
member.remarks: Most of Aspose products are supposed to have just one edition type. Only complex products might have two edition types. When using two edition types, make sure it is easy for the client to select edition type they need.
member.param: Specify edition type that is required to access your feature.
Message that explains what feature the user is trying to access.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary:
Verifies the signature on the XML file and loads it into the license files, but does not check them. Made internal only for unit testing, do not call directly otherwise.
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.MapOldProductName(System.String)
member.summary: In January 2006 product names such as Aspose Word, Aspose Excel etc had to be changed. This function maps these product names so old licenses can be used in new products.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.String)
member.summary: See above. Use for unit testing only.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.VerifySignature(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary:
Verifies that content of the data element has not been tampered with. Safe to pass nulls.
Note there is no direct action taken inside this method if the signature is invalid. If the signature is invalid, the VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag is set to greater than zero and you need to examine it somewhere later in your code. This is to confuse hackers.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.ProbeLicense(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Tries to find the license in several locations: 1. Explicit path. 2. The folder of this assembly. 3. The folder of the client's calling assembly. 4. The folder of the entry assembly (does not apply for the .NET Compact Framework). 5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
member.param: This can be full or short file name or name of an embedded resource.
Client's calling assembly. Used to find license in embedded resource.
member.returns: Returns a stream that contains the license or throws.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.LicenseCore.GetAssemblyPath(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Returns assembly path correctly even if the assembly is shadow-copied. Uses CodeBase instead of Location for that.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.InnerStyle
member.summary: Summary description for InnerStyle.

members.member: bits name mask 0 cell locked 0x00000001 1 formula hidden 0x00000002 2 wrapped 0x00000004 3 shrink 0x00000008 4 diagonal up 0x00000010 5 diagonal down 0x00000020 7-6 RESERVED FOR BOOLEAN 15-8 format index 0x0000FF00 19-16 H-Alignment 0x000F0000 23-20 V-Alignment 0x00F00000 31-24 rotation 0xFF000000 // caution: sign bit used!

bits name mask 3-0 indent 0x0000000F 5-4 text direction 0x00000030 7-6 NOT USED 11-8 left border style 0x00000F00 15-12 right border style 0x0000F000 19-16 top border style 0x000F0000 23-20 bottom border style 0x00F00000 27-24 diagonal border style 0x0F000000 31-28 NOT USED

_font and _colors fields are not initialized by default to save memory. _colors can be null but if _colors is not null, _colors[x] MUST NOT be null. So if the outer class like Style initializes the _colors array, all members in the array should also be created. By default, all the flags are not set. But outer classes like Style should set corresponding flags when it's setXXX methods are called.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor
member.summary:
Contains flags set by the meaningful comparer methods. This is necessary to ensure that crackers have not cut out the entry point of the verification algorithm located in LicenseCore.VerifySignature() and all the methods have been called. The flags should be set by 3 comparer methods subsequently, each method must check if the previous method has been invoked.
Also see SignatureInvalidFlag in this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.Clear
member.summary: Made accessible so license unit tests can reset the static state properly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked
member.summary: Returns 0x100 if all methods have been invoked properly, returns 0x1000 otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag
member.summary:
If EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked says that verification methods were called and SignatureInvalidFlag is zero, then the signature was verified and it was correct.
This is set to greater than zero if signature verification failed at some stage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag1
member.summary: Used for checking if methods 1 and 2 were invoked. Initial value = 0x30. Method 1 must check it and if it is 0x30, set it to 0xff, otherwise leave intact. Method 2 then must check it and if it is 0xff, set it to 0x80, otherwise leave intact.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag2
member.summary: Used for checking if method 3 was invoked. Initial value = true. Method 3 must set it to false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.SetCellValue(System.Object)
member.summary: If the value is a formula,this method set cell's value as FormulaType, but not calculate formula. To calculate formula,need call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas manually. If multi values to be set,call this method multi times, finally,call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas method manually to calculate formulas. This is more effective. It will not auto calculate formulas in any case even GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas is true.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.GetFont
member.summary: Gets cell font. When change the font, you should invoke "SetFont" method, to set font to cell.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.GetFontColor
member.summary: Gets cell font color. When change the color,you should invoke "SetFontColor" method, to set font color to cell.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.SetFont(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Sets font to cell. To improve performance,implement "SetFont" method, not implement "Font" property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.SetFontColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets font color to cell. To improve performance,implement "SetFontColor" method, not implement "FontColor" property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets worksheet object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Row
member.summary: Gets cell row index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Column
member.summary: Gets cell column index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Name
member.summary: Gets cell name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Location
member.summary: Gets GridCell location.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a cell value. If value is formula, the set method of this property will call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas method automatic if GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas property is true. So, if there are many formulas, using SetCellValue method instead of this property. SetCellValue method will enhance performance. If GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas property is false, it will not call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Formula
member.summary: Read only,to set formula,use Value set attribute. If cell value is not a formula,returns null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Protected
member.summary: Indicates if the cell is protected. If the value is "true", user can not modify the cell through the user interface. This attribute has nothing to do with the Style.CellLocked property and will not be saved to file when grid data exported. The default value is "false".
